column4: Here's my story: I installed Ubuntu 6.04 on a laptop. It was good except that I couldn't get it to connect to my wireless network. Someone recommended that I upgrade. I upgraded to 7 and the pc would no longer shut down. And after hard power off it wouldn't boot up the first time. It's gotten worse and worse.. .
I suggest you get the cd to 7.04 and make a proper clean install, that whould resolve a lot of problems
Did that. Re-partioned. Re-format. Clean install. Still unstable.
what is the current state or your comp,  I mean how far do you get when you boot and what msg if any do you get ?
the latest install is an attempt to go back to 6, I get the ubuntu splash, the load bar and driver scroll, it then goes to a blank screen with a flashing cursor and stops.
what is your videocard ?
actually, the cursor stops flashing.
what is your videocard ?
Not sure. Whatever is in a Thinkpad T20.
that could be related because when I updated from 6 I suddenly lost the 1024x768 and only had up to 640x480.
that doesn't tell me much ,  the only thing I can suggest at this point is a clean install of 7.04, drivers are better
After that, I clean installed 7 and that solved that video problem but it was unstable. It would take 3 or 4 reboots for it to finally come up.
can you boot yoru computer now ????

not at all. I did an install from the disk. It asks for the reboot. It doesn't want to shut down. I had reboot.It comes back up and completes the install and updates. Won't shut down. Hard reboot. Blank screen and frozen cursor.
ok  so the problem it that it won'T shutdown nicely,  got it now

that's the first thing, but then it won't come back up, of course. I have a BIOS update that should probably be installed but it will only run from windows. I tried re-installing windows but could only get my 95 disk to install. The BIOS patch wouldn't run. Couldn't get the 98 to install. Ugh.
read this and see if it applies  http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=340016&highlight=can%2527T+shutdown

the link you pointed to seems similar except that I don't have any error or message when the shutdown fails. It just stops at a splash screen. Of course, holding down the power button shuts it off, so in and of itself the shutdown isn't the problem. The real grief is that it will not boot back up.
try the solution anyway, it can't realy hurt
Kind of hard to try the solution when the PC will not boot. I'll have to try yet another clean install.
that's the best I can do for you , I am sorry,  I,m just a user maybe one of the other know's how to fix your problem but I don't sorry
